Utilities

Class KeyBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • Utilities.KeyBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class KeyBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    A Class which can hold the state of the Keyboard at the current instant.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyBoard

        public KeyBoard()
        Constructs a new KeyBoard. Currently only supports A-Z and 9-0 and Up, Down, Left, Right, Down, Shift, Alt, Ctrl, Backspace, Space and Enter. Also the Numpad;

    • Method Detail

      • setPressed

        public void setPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        This takes in a KeyEvent from the KeyPressed method in a KeyListener class. It will then determine what key was pressed,and set that key to true in the class. Currently only supports A-Z and 0-9
        Parameters:
        e - -the KeyEvent from the method

      • setRelease

        public void setRelease(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        This takes in a KeyEvent from the KeyReleased method in a KeyListener class. It will then determine what key was released,and set that key to false in the class.
        Parameters:
        e - -the KeyEvent which occurred.

      • isKeyDown

        public boolean isKeyDown(char b)
        Takes in a character value, and checks to see if that value is currently set to true. Will only return false if that character's associated key is not pressed, or if it is not supported Only Supports Alpha-Numeric Keys
        Parameters:
        b - -character value of a key
        Returns:
        -whether or not that key is currently pressed down

      • isKeyDown

        public boolean isKeyDown(int c)
        Takes in an Int value from the KeyEvent class's Virtual Key values and checks to see if that value is currently set to true. Will only return false if that int's associated key is not pressed, or if it is not supported
        Parameters:
        c - -the Int value of a Virtual Key
        Returns:
        -whether or not that value's key is pressed or not
        See Also:
        KeyEvent

      • isKeyUp

        public boolean isKeyUp(int c)
        Tests to see if a Virtual Key int valu of a key is currently not being pressed Will return false if the key is pressed, or if that wanted key is not implemented
        Parameters:
        c - -the int value from a Virtual Key
        Returns:
        -Whether or not that key is pressed
        See Also:
        KeyEvent

      • isKeyUp

        public boolean isKeyUp(char b)
        Takes the passed in character and tests if the key associated with that character is false. Will only return false if the key is down, or not implemented
        Parameters:
        b - -character of the key
        Returns:
        -will return if

      • clone

        public KeyBoard clone()
        Will clone this instance of the class.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        -a clone of this instance
